items.title: US sets deadline for peace deal between Ukraine and Russia
items.standfirst: The United States wants Kyiv and Moscow to end the nearly four-year war by June, and has offered to host talks between the two sides next week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said. items.title: Zelenskyy says US has set June deadline for Ukraine-Russia peace deal
items.standfirst: Ukrainian president says Trump administration has proposed to host next round of trilateral talks in USVolodymyr Zelenskyy has said the US has given Ukraine and Russia yet another deadline to reach a peace settlement, and is now proposing the war should end by June. The Ukrainian president also told reporters that both sides had been invited to further talks next week.Zelenskyy said the Trump administration “will probably put pressure” on Ukraine and Russia to end the war by the beginning of the summer. “They say they want to get everything done by June,” he said. “They will do everything to end the war and they want a clear schedule of all events.” Continue reading...

items.title: France’s former minister Jack Lang ‘offers’ to resign from Arab World Institute over Epstein links
items.standfirst: Jack Lang, France’s former culture minister, on Saturday “offered” to resign as head of the prestigious Arab World Institute in Paris after he and his daughter Caroline were mentioned in the latest batch of documents related to the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The day before, France’s financial crimes prosecutors announced they had opened a probe into the Lang family’s ties with Epstein. Lang is also due to appear before Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot after being summoned.
items.content: Jack Lang, France’s former culture minister, on Saturday “offered” to resign as head of the prestigious Arab World Institute in Paris after he and his daughter Caroline were mentioned in the latest batch of documents related to the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The day before, France’s financial crimes prosecutors announced they had opened a probe into the Lang family’s ties with Epstein. Lang is also due to appear before Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot after being summoned.

items.title: Paris probes Jack Lang over Epstein link
items.standfirst: In France, all eyes are on Jack Lang, who has been summoned to the Quai d’Orsay tomorrow. The president of the Arab World Institute and his daughter, Caroline Lang, are both the subject of an investigation by the financial prosecutor’s office for aggravated money laundering linked to tax fraud. France 2 Benoit Chavatte and France 24 Daniel Quinlan take a closer look.
items.content: In France, all eyes are on Jack Lang, who has been summoned to the Quai d’Orsay tomorrow. The president of the Arab World Institute and his daughter, Caroline Lang, are both the subject of an investigation by the financial prosecutor’s office for aggravated money laundering linked to tax fraud. France 2 Benoit Chavatte and France 24 Daniel Quinlan take a closer look.

clusters.title: Starmer leadership speculation ‘serious’ but task ahead ‘very clear’, says Brown – as it happened

items.title: Starmer leadership speculation ‘serious’ but task ahead ‘very clear’, says Brown – as it happened
items.standfirst: This live blog is now closedAmid mounting speculation that Keir Starmer could quit over the Mandelson scandal, Gordon Brown has described the prime minister as a “man of integrity” but said he faced a “serious” challenge to remain in his role.Police officers probing accusations relating to Peter Mandelson’s links with Jeffrey Epstein have concluded their search of two properties connected to the Labour peer in London and Wiltshire.Met police said its investigation “will take some time” and that “a significant amount of further evidence gathering and analysis” was needed.The Liberal Democrats have urged the Financial Conduct Authority to immediately investigate Mandelson, saying his apparent decision to leak highly confidential government information to Epstein may have led to insider trading.Brown said the alleged leaks put Britain “at risk” and could have caused “huge commercial damage”.The Metropolitan police has provided an update on the searches of two properties linked to Mandelson. Continue reading...
items.content: This live blog is now closedAmid mounting speculation that Keir Starmer could quit over the Mandelson scandal, Gordon Brown has described the prime minister as a “man of integrity” but said he faced a “serious” challenge to remain in his role.Police officers probing accusations relating to Peter Mandelson’s links with Jeffrey Epstein have concluded their search of two properties connected to the Labour peer in London and Wiltshire.Met police said its investigation “will take some time” and that “a significant amount of further evidence gathering and analysis” was needed.The Liberal Democrats have urged the Financial Conduct Authority to immediately investigate Mandelson, saying his apparent decision to leak highly confidential government information to Epstein may have led to insider trading.Brown said the alleged leaks put Britain “at risk” and could have caused “huge commercial damage”.The Metropolitan police has provided an update on the searches of two properties linked to Mandelson. Continue reading...

items.title: UK police search two properties linked to Mandelson
items.standfirst: Revelations from the Jeffrey Epstein files are shaking British politics, as UK police search two properties linked to Lord Peter Mandelson, the Labour MP and former UK ambassador to the United States, as part of an investigation into potential misconduct in public office. The development has renewed pressure on Prime Minister Keir Starmer over his 2024 decision to appoint Mandelson as Washington envoy, despite his known ties to the convicted sex offender. Liza Kaminov examines what the latest Epstein files reveal about Lord Mandelson.
items.content: Revelations from the Jeffrey Epstein files are shaking British politics, as UK police search two properties linked to Lord Peter Mandelson, the Labour MP and former UK ambassador to the United States, as part of an investigation into potential misconduct in public office. The development has renewed pressure on Prime Minister Keir Starmer over his 2024 decision to appoint Mandelson as Washington envoy, despite his known ties to the convicted sex offender. Liza Kaminov examines what the latest Epstein files reveal about Lord Mandelson.

ai_summary: Police search two properties linked to Mandelson
Investigation into potential misconduct in public office
Alleged leaks may have caused huge commercial damage
Gordon Brown describes Starmer as a man of integrity
Met police say investigation will take some time

clusters.neutral_headline: US Arrests Suspect in 2012 Benghazi Attack

items.title: US arrest suspect in 2012 Benghazi attack
items.standfirst: A suspect accused of being a "key participant" in the deadly attack on an American consulate in Benghazi, Libya, in 2012 has been taken into US custody, the Department of Justice (DOJ) has announced. Jennie Shin reports.
items.content: A suspect accused of being a "key participant" in the deadly attack on an American consulate in Benghazi, Libya, in 2012 has been taken into US custody, the Department of Justice (DOJ) has announced. Jennie Shin reports.

items.title: Pam Bondi announces arrest of ‘key participant’ in 2012 Benghazi attack
items.standfirst: Zubayar al-Bakoush is suspected in Libya attack resulting in deaths of US ambassador and three other AmericansThe US attorney general, Pam Bondi, announced on Friday the arrest of a “key participant” in the 2012 Benghazi terrorist attack that killed four US government officials, including the US ambassador to Libya, J Christopher Stevens.Bondi said the suspect, Zubayar al-Bakoush, was taken into US custody at 3am ET on Friday. “We will prosecute this alleged terrorist to the fullest extent of the law. He’ll face charges related to murder, terrorism, arson, among others,” Bondi told reporters at a press conference at the Department of Justice in Washington DC. Continue reading...
items.content: Zubayar al-Bakoush is suspected in Libya attack resulting in deaths of US ambassador and three other AmericansThe US attorney general, Pam Bondi, announced on Friday the arrest of a “key participant” in the 2012 Benghazi terrorist attack that killed four US government officials, including the US ambassador to Libya, J Christopher Stevens.Bondi said the suspect, Zubayar al-Bakoush, was taken into US custody at 3am ET on Friday. “We will prosecute this alleged terrorist to the fullest extent of the law. He’ll face charges related to murder, terrorism, arson, among others,” Bondi told reporters at a press conference at the Department of Justice in Washington DC. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Suspect accused of being key participant in attack
Zubayar al-Bakoush taken into US custody
Alleged terrorist faces charges related to murder
Attack resulted in deaths of four US government officials
US attorney general announces arrest

clusters.title: Could Bad Bunny set off political fireworks at the Super Bowl half-time show?
clusters.neutral_headline: Bad Bunny to Perform at Super Bowl

items.title: Could Bad Bunny set off political fireworks at the Super Bowl half-time show?
items.standfirst: With Super Bowl half-time shows becoming increasingly polarised, how will the Puerto Rican superstar quiet his detractors?
items.content: With Super Bowl half-time shows becoming increasingly polarised, how will the Puerto Rican superstar quiet his detractors?

items.title: Watch: Bad Bunny lookalikes compete ahead of Super Bowl
items.standfirst: The Puerto Rican rapper, who won a Grammy for album of the year, will be the first artist to perform the half time show entirely in Spanish.
items.content: The Puerto Rican rapper, who won a Grammy for album of the year, will be the first artist to perform the half time show entirely in Spanish.

ai_summary: Bad Bunny will perform half-time show in Spanish
Super Bowl half-time shows become increasingly polarised
Bad Bunny won a Grammy for album of the year
Lookalikes compete ahead of Super Bowl
Performance may spark political controversy
